action.action-desc: Mr. McDowell introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the 21st Century Cures Act to improve the administration, oversight, and impact of opioid use disorder grants, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Clarity for Opioid-Use Reduction and Expenditures Act or the CURE Act.

section.header: Improving administration, oversight, and impact of opioid use disorder grants

subsection.text: Subsection (c) of section 1003 of the 21st Century Cures Act (42 U.S.C. 290ee–3a) is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall develop and implement a standardized system for collecting data from States receiving grants under subsection (b).
A State receiving a grant under subsection (b) shall submit to the Secretary, through the standardized system referred to in paragraph (1), on a quarterly basis, a description of—

subparagraph.text: the purposes for which the grant funds received by the State under such subsection for the preceding fiscal year were expended and a description of the activities of the State under the grant;
the ultimate recipients of amounts provided to the State, including the name, location, and taxpayer identification number of any grant subrecipients;
the number of individuals served through the grant; and
such other information as determined appropriate by the Secretary.

paragraph.header: Use of other Federal grant-tracking systems
paragraph.text: The Secretary shall, in collecting data through the standardized system referred to in paragraph (1), to the extent feasible, make use of other Federal grant-tracking systems to avoid duplication of efforts.

subsection.text: Section 1003(f) of the 21st Century Cures Act (42 U.S.C. 290ee–3a(f)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by amending paragraph (2) to read as follows:
the activities of the recipients and subrecipients of the grants; and
by amending paragraph (3) to read as follows:
each entity that receives a grant or is a subrecipient of a grant under this section, including the funding level provided to such recipient or subrecipient.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsections (a) and (b) shall apply beginning 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act.
